'''Balbir Singh Sodhi''' (1949 – September 15, 2001),<ref name="splc">{{cite web | title = Remembering Victims of Hate Crimes | publisher = Southern Poverty Law Center | accessdate = 2013-07-05 | url = http://www.splcenter.org/get-informed/intelligence-report/browse-all-issues/2002/spring/the-forgotten?page=0,6 }}</ref> a [[Sikhism in the United States|Sikh-American]] gas station owner in [[Mesa, Arizona]], was murdered in a [[hate crime]] in the aftermath of the [[September 11 attacks]]. This was the first of several cases across the [[United States]] that were reported to the police as supposed acts of retaliation for the attacks. Balbir Singh Sodhi, who wore a beard and a [[turban]] in accordance with his [[Sikh]] faith, was mistaken for an [[Arab]] [[Muslim]] and murdered by 42-year-old [[Frank Silva Roque]], a [[Boeing]] aircraft mechanic at a local repair facility who held a criminal record for an [[robbery|attempted robbery]] in [[California]]. Roque had reportedly told friends that he was "going to go out and shoot some towel-heads" the day of the attacks.<ref>{{cite news|first=Valarie|last=Karr|url=https://www.pri.org/stories/2016-09-23/his-brother-was-murdered-wearing-turban-after-911-last-week-he-spoke-killer|title=His brother was murdered for wearing a turban after 9/11. 15 years later, he spoke to the killer|work=pri.org|date=September 23, 2016|accessdate=May 15, 2018}}</ref> Roque was sentenced to death ([[clemency|commuted]] later to [[life imprisonment]]) for [[first degree murder]].
== Background == Born in [[Punjab, India]], Balbir Singh Sodhi was a member of the [[Sikh]] religion. He immigrated to the United States in 1989 and initially resided in [[Los Angeles]], where he worked as a computer engineer and analyst at [[Hewlett-Packard|HP]]. He saved enough money to buy a gas station and several affiliated franchises in [[Phoenix, Arizona]] and moved there.<ref name="NYT09-17-2001">{{cite news|first=Tamar | last=Lewin | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2001/09/17/us/sikh-owner-of-gas-station-is-fatally-shot-in-rampage.html? | newspaper=[[The New York Times]] | title=Sikh Owner Of Gas Station Is Fatally Shot In Rampage | date=September 17, 2001}}</ref>
On September 11, 2001, members of [[al-Qaeda]], a militant [[Islamist]] group, hijacked four airplanes and perpetrated [[September 11 attacks|the 9/11 attacks]], killing 2,977 victims. According to family members, Sodhi had become distraught by the attacks.<ref>{{cite news|first=Naomi|last=Gingold|url=https://www.pri.org/stories/2016-09-20/brother-one-first-hate-crime-victims-post-911-keeps-teaching-tolerance|title=The brother of one of the first hate-crime victims post 9/11 keeps on teaching tolerance|work=pri.org|date=September 20, 2016|accessdate=May 15, 2018}}</ref>
==Roque shootings== On September 15, 2001, Roque took his [[Chevrolet S-10]] from the Wild Hare sports bar in [[Mesa, Arizona|Mesa]], where he had reportedly been ranting about immigrants, and drove to the [[Chevron Corporation|Chevron gas station]] owned by Sodhi. Roque shot Sodhi five times from his truck with a .380 handgun, killing him. At the time of the shooting, Sodhi was helping landscaper Luis Ledesma plant flowers around the edge of his gas station.<ref>{{cite news|first=Gary|last=Grado|url=http://www.eastvalleytribune.com/news/roque-could-get-death-penalty-for-sikh-murder/article_83b74c56-3b8f-5e72-85af-ce8d4a4d944d.html|title=Roque could get death penalty for Sikh murder|work=[[East Valley Tribune]]|publisher=[[Times Media Group]]|location=Tempe, Arizona|date=October 1, 2003|accessdate=May 15, 2018}}</ref>
Roque, who apparently wanted revenge for the 9/11 attacks, mistook him for an [[Arab]] [[Muslim]] because of the clothes he wore, his [[turban]], and his beard. Roque then drove to a [[Mobil|Mobil gas station]] 10 miles away. Twenty minutes after the first shooting, he shot at a [[Lebanon|Lebanese]]-American clerk from his truck, but missed.<ref name="NYT09-17-2001" /> Roque then drove to his former residence, which had been purchased by a local Afghan family, and fired multiple rounds at the outside of the house. After fleeing the scene of the final shooting, Roque was reported to have gone to a local bar and boasted, "They're investigating the murder of a turban-head down the street."<ref>{{Cite news |first=Sunny | last=Hundal| title = Wisconsin temple shooting: Sikhs have been silent scapegoats since 9/11 | url = https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2012/aug/06/wisconsin-temple-shooting-sikh-scapegoats | work = [[The Guardian]] | publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]]|location=London, England|date = August 6, 2012|accessdate = August 8, 2012 }}</ref><ref name="splc"/>
==Arrest, trial, conviction== Police arrested Roque the next day, initially unaware of the later shooting incidents. He reportedly shouted slogans including "I am a patriot!" and "I stand for America all the way!" during his arrest.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usccr.gov/pubs/sac/dc0603/ch6.htm|title=Chapter 6: Fears and Concerns of Affected, At-Risk Communities|website=Usccr.gov|accessdate=4 July 2016}}</ref> His [[bail]] was set at $1 million.
Roque's [[trial by jury]] began on August 18, 2003. Defense attorneys argued he was not guilty [[plea of insanity|due to insanity]], claiming that he had a diminished [[IQ]] and heard relentless voices telling him that Arabs were Satanic and must be killed. Two coworkers testified that Roque was "narrow-minded" and that he hated both immigrants and Arabs. Roque's defense attorney characterized him as mentally ill, and noted that his mother had twice been hospitalized for [[schizophrenia]], a condition which has been shown to appear in those genetically predisposed to it.<ref name="Guardian">{{cite news|first=Julian|last=Borger|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/oct/11/usa.julianborger|title=September 11 revenge killer to die for shooting Sikh|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[Guardian Media Group]]|location=London, England|date=10 October 2003|accessdate=15 May 2018}}</ref> On September 30, 2003, he was found guilty of [[first degree murder]], and was [[capital punishment|sentenced to death]] nine days later.<ref name="Guardian"/>
On July 19, 2005, Roque was found guilty of an unspecified conspiracy charge while in prison, specified only as a violent crime. On February 27, 2006, he was found guilty of having manufactured a primitive weapon in prison three days earlier. In August 2006, the Arizona Supreme Court changed Roque's death sentence to a sentence of life in prison without parole, citing his low IQ and [[mental illness]] as [[mitigating factor]]s.<ref>{{cite web|first1=Michael|last1=Kiefer|first2=Jim|last2=Walsh|title=9/11-tied slayer won't be executed|url=http://www.azcentral.com/arizonarepublic/local/articles/0815roque0815.html |work=[[Arizona Republic]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Phoenix, Arizona|date=August 15, 2006|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120720154640/http://www.azcentral.com/arizonarepublic/local/articles/0815roque0815.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=July 20, 2012 |accessdate=December 10, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://korematsu.blogspot.com/2006/08/arizona-supreme-court-overturns-death.html |title=DNSI Blog: Arizona Supreme Court Overturns Death Sentence for Frank Roque - Killer of Balbir Singh Sodhi |publisher=Korematsu.blogspot.com |date=August 15, 2006 |accessdate=July 29, 2010}}</ref> The trial was aired by [[Court TV]] in a five-part series.<ref>{{cite news|first=Jim|last=Walsh|url=http://tucsoncitizen.com/morgue2/2003/09/03/149112-killer-of-sikh-after-9-11-called-ill/|title=Killer of Sikh after 9-11 called ill|work=[[Tucson Citizen]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Tucson, Arizona|date=September 3, 2003|accessdate=May 15, 2018}}</ref>
==Sukhpal Sodhi== On August 4, 2002, less than a year after Sodhi's death, his younger brother Sukhpal was shot to death while driving his taxicab in San Francisco, apparently killed by a stray bullet from a nearby [[gang]] fight. In response to this second tragedy, Balbir's son Sukhwinder said, "What are you going to do with anger? We like peace and we are a peaceful people."<ref>{{cite web|first1=Judi|last1=Villa|first2=Adam|last2=Klawonn|url=http://www.sikhmediawatch.org/newsite/news/newsdetail.asp?newsid%3D50 |title=Brother of slain Valley Sikh killed in San Francicso (sic)|work=[[The Arizona Republic]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Phoenix, Arizona|date=August 6, 2002|accessdate=June 8, 2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030122220844/http://www.sikhmediawatch.org/newsite/news/newsdetail.asp?newsid=50 |archivedate=January 22, 2003 }}</ref>

[[Image:Logo of the National Intelligence Council.gif|thumb|Logo of the National Intelligence Council]] The '''National Intelligence Council''' ('''NIC''') is the center for midterm and long-term strategic thinking within the [[United States Intelligence Community]] (IC). It was formed in 1979. According to its official website:
* It leads the IC's effort to produce [[National Intelligence Estimate]]s and other documents; * It supports (and reports to) the [[United States Director of National Intelligence|Director of National Intelligence]]; * It serves as a focal point for [[policymaker]]s' questions; * It contributes to the effort to allocate IC resources in response to policy changes; and * It communicates with experts in [[academia]] and the [[private sector]] to broaden the IC's perspective;
The NIC's goal is to provide policymakers with the best information: unvarnished, unbiased and without regard to whether the analytic judgments conform to current U.S. policy.
One of the NICs most important analytical projects is a Global Trends report produced for the incoming US president. The report is delivered to the incoming president between Election Day and [[Inauguration Day]], and it assesses critical drivers and scenarios for global trends with an approximate time horizon of fifteen years. The Global Trends analysis provides a basis for long-range strategic policy assessment for the White House and the intelligence community. The NIC's most recent Global Trends report, "Global Trends 2035: Paradox of Progress" was released in January 2017.<ref>[https://www.dni.gov/files/images/globalTrends/documents/GT-Full-Report.pdf NIC Global Trends 2035]</ref>
On February 2, 2007, the [[Office of the Director of National Intelligence]], and the National Intelligence Council released the National Intelligence Estimate (NIE)—{{"-}}'Prospects for Iraq's Stability: A Challenging Road Ahead' Unclassified Key Judgments".<ref>[http://www.dni.gov/press_releases/20070202_release.pdf Iraq National Intelligence Estimate (NIE) - "Prospects for Iraq's Stability: A Challenging Road Ahead" Unclassified Key Judgments] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070302125700/http://www.dni.gov/press_releases/20070202_release.pdf |date=2007-03-02 }}.</ref>
== Organization == The NIC has a Chairman and Vice Chairman, as well as a Vice Chairman for Evaluation, a Director of Strategic Plans and Outreach, a Director of Analysis and Production Staff, a Special Adviser, and [[National Intelligence Officer]]s (NIOs) and Deputy National Intelligence Officer for each of the following areas and subject matters:
* [[Africa]] * [[East Asia]] * [[Europe]] * [[Latin America]] * [[Near East]] * [[South Asia]] * [[Russia]] and [[Eurasia]] * [[Economics]] & Global Issues * Science & Technology * Intelligence Assurance * Military Issues * [[Transnationalism|Transnational]] Threats * Warning * [[Weapons of mass destruction|Weapons of Mass Destruction]] and Proliferation

{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox artist | bgcolour = #6495ED | name = Pavel Filonov | image = Filonov Selfportrait 1921.JPG | imagesize = | caption = Self portrait | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|1883|1|8|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Moscow, Russia]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1941|12|3|1883|1|8|mf=y}} | death_place = | nationality = Russian | field = Painting | training = | movement = | works = | patrons = | influenced by = | influenced = | awards = }}
'''Pavel Nikolayevich Filonov''' ({{lang-rus|Па́вел Никола́евич Фило́нов|p=ˈpavʲɪl nʲɪkɐˈlajɪvʲɪtɕ fʲɪˈlonəf|a=Pavyel Nikolayevich Filonov.ru.vorb.oga}}; January 8, 1883 – December 3, 1941) was a [[Russian avant-garde]] painter, art theorist, and poet.
==Biography== [[Image:Pavel Filonov Glebova.jpg|thumb|200px|right|''Portrait of E. N. Glebova'' (the artist's sister), 1915, oil on canvas. 117x152.5 cm. [[Russian Museum]].]] Filonov was born in Moscow on January 8, 1883 ([[Gregorian calendar]]) or December 27, 1882 ([[Julian calendar]]). In 1897, he moved to [[Saint Petersburg|St. Petersburg]] where he took art lessons. In 1908, he entered [[Imperial Academy of Arts|St. Petersburg Academy of Arts]], from which, he was expelled in 1910.
In 1910–1914, he took part in the arts group [[Soyuz Molodyozhi]] created by artists [[Elena Guro]] and [[Mikhail Matyushin]]. In 1912, he wrote the article ''The Canon and the Law'', in which, he formulated the principles of [[analytical art|analytical realism]], or "anti-Cubism". According to Filonov, [[Cubism]] represents objects using elements of their surface geometry but "analytical realists" should represent objects using elements of their inner soul. He was faithful to these principles for the remainder of his life. [[Image:Pavel Filonov HolyFamily.jpg|thumb|left|200px|''[[Peasant Family|A Peasant Family (The Holy Family)]]'', 1914, oil on canvas, 159x128 cm, [[Russian Museum]].]]
During the years 1913 to 1915, Filonov was close to [[Vladimir Mayakovsky]], [[Velimir Khlebnikov]], and other [[Russian Futurism|futurists]]. He co-illustrated Khlebnikov's ''Selected Poems with Postscript, 1907–1914'' alongside [[Kazimir Malevich]] during this time.<ref name="WDL">{{cite web |url = http://www.wdl.org/en/item/9236/ |title = Selected Poems with Postscript, 1907–1914 |website = [[World Digital Library]] |year = 1914 |accessdate = 2013-09-28 }}</ref> In the autumn of 1916, he enlisted for service in World War I, and served on the [[Romania]]n front. Filonov participated actively in the [[Russian Revolution of 1917]] and served as the Chairman of the Revolutionary War Committee of Dunay region.
In 1919, he exhibited in the First Free Exhibit of Artists of All Trends at the [[Hermitage Museum|Hermitage]]. In 1923, he became a professor of St. Petersburg Academy of Arts and a member of the Institute for Artistic Culture (INKhUK). He organized a large arts school of Masters of Analytical Realism (over seventy artists). Their work influenced [[suprematism]] and [[expressionism]].
In 1929, a large retrospective exhibition of Filonov art was planned at the [[Russian Museum]]; however, the Soviet government forbade the exhibition from going forward. From 1932 onward, Filonov literally starved but still refused to sell his works to private collectors. He wanted to give all his works to the Russian Museum as a gift so as to start a Museum of Analytical Realism. He died of starvation on December 3, 1941 during the [[Siege of Leningrad|Nazi Siege of Leningrad]].
==Method== Under the umbrella of [[Universal Flowering]], Filonov put forth a manner of working that proceeded from the particular to the general. He believed that objects and fields should be built up from small details and bits and stated that doing it the other-way-round was nothing short of "charlatanism". To this end, he worked, and required his students to work, with very small brushes in painting and the finest of points when drawing.
==Legacy==
Most of Filonov's works were saved by his sister Yevdokiya Nikolayevna Glebova. She stored the paintings in the Russian Museum's archives and eventually donated them as a gift. Exhibitions of Filonov's work were forbidden. In 1967, an exhibition of Filonov's works in [[Novosibirsk]] was permitted. In 1988, his work was allowed in the Russian Museum. In 1989 and 1990, the first international exhibition of Filonov's work was held in Paris.
During the period of half-legal status of Filonov's works it was seemingly easy to steal them; however, there was a [https://web.archive.org/web/20071230105139/http://www.tv-ostankino.ru/material/Material_459_42.htm legend] that Filonov's ghost protected his art and anybody trying to steal his paintings or to smuggle them abroad would soon die, become paralyzed, or have a similar misfortune.<!--is this encyclopedic?--> {{clear}}
==Selected works== <gallery> Image:Pavel_Filonov_Heads.jpg|''Heads'' (1910). Filonov considered this painting to be his first real work. Image:Pavel_Filonov_ManWoman.jpg|''A Man and a Woman (Adam and Eve)'' (1912–1913). Image:Pavel_Filonov_KingsFeat.jpg|''The Banquet of Kings'' (1913). Image:Pavel Filonov universal flowering.jpg|''universal flowering'' (1915). Image:Pavel_Filonov_Pedagogics.jpg|''The Formula of Contemporary Pedagogy of IZO'' (1923). Image:Pavel_Filonov_Horses.jpg|''Horses'' (1924–1925). Image:Pavel_Filonov_2Heads.jpg|''Two Heads. Rabbles'' (1925). Image:Pavel_Filonov_Animals.jpg|''Animals'' (1930). Image:Pavel_Filonov_Faces.jpg|''Countenances (Faces on an Icon)'' (1940) </gallery>

[[Nygård International]] }} '''Peter J. Nygård''' (born 1943) is a [[Finnish Canadians|Finnish-Canadian]] [[clothing|fashion]] executive, founder and chairman of [[Nygård International]], a company based in [[Winnipeg]] that makes women's wear. He was rated the 70th richest Canadian by ''[[Canadian Business Magazine]]'' in 2009 with a net worth of $817 million {{cite web|last=Kirbyson |first=Geoff |url=http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/breakingnews/manitobans-make-magazines-rich-100-list-70447987.html |title=Manitobans make magazine's Rich 100 list |publisher=Winnipeg Free Press |date=2009-11-19 |accessdate=2010-04-14}}, but he is not shown on the Canadian Business ranking of the 100 wealthiest individuals and families in Canada 2018 list [https://www.canadianbusiness.com/lists-and-rankings/richest-people/100-richest-canadians-complete-list/] ==Early life and education== Nygård was born in [[Helsinki]], [[Finland]] in 1943. His parents were Eeli and Hilkka Nygård, bakers who immigrated to [[Canada]] in 1952, settling at first in [[Deloraine, Manitoba]] (where [[Nygård Park]] would later be named in his honour in 2002). They moved shortly after to [[Winnipeg]].http://www4.nygard.com/uploadedFiles/News/YEAR_2010/News_2010/full_HilkkaNygard_new.pdf In 1964, he graduated from the [[University of North Dakota]] with a business degree.http://www4.nygard.com/scf/News2003.aspx?id=357{{cite web |url= http://www.innovators.net/innovators/public_html/about_the_center/entrepreneur_hall.html |title= North Dakota Entrepreneur Hall of Fame |publisher= innovators.net |accessdate= 12 July 2010 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20110429024652/http://www.innovators.net/innovators/public_html/about_the_center/entrepreneur_hall.html |archive-date= 2011-04-29 |dead-url= yes |df= }}{{cite web |url= http://www.innovators.net/innovators/public_html/about_the_center/entrepreneur_awards.html |title= Entrepreneur Awards |publisher= innovators.net |accessdate= 12 July 2011 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20110701145531/http://www.innovators.net/innovators/public_html/about_the_center/entrepreneur_awards.html |archive-date= 2011-07-01 |dead-url= yes |df= }} ==Tan Jay== On December 1, 1967, Nygård started working as sales manager for a new jeans line of a woman’s clothing manufacturer Jacob Fashions . A few weeks later Nygård used his life [[savings]] of $8,000 and an additional [[loan]] to purchase 20% of the company from the founder Nathan Jacob. A few years later, Nygård bought the rest of the company from Jacobs daughters and renamed it Tan Jay.[http://jonesbahamas.com/the-opportunity-that-led-to-a-fortune/] Nygård apparel manufacturing company was founded in 1967 in [[Winnipeg]], Manitoba. Its Canada headquarters is now in [[Toronto]], Ontario with its world headquarters in [[Times Square]], [[New York City|New York]].{{cite web|url=http://corporate.nygard.com/company-profile/?ID=31&Folder_id=14 |title=Nygard International Company Profile}} Nygård's fashion concept retail store opened in [[Times Square]] in [[Manhattan]] on Friday, November 6, 2009. ==Nygård Cay== In 1987, Nygård built a {{convert|150000|sqft|m2|adj=on}} compound at [[Lyford Cay]] in the Bahamas. It was partly destroyed by a fire on November 10, 2009.[http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/breakingnews/Fire-destroys-Nygards-Bahamas-compound-69911722.html "Fire destroys Nygard's Bahamas compound"], [[Winnipeg Free Press]], November 10, 2009 The Cay is inspired by the [[Mayan civilization]]’s architecture. One of the major buildings is a 32,000 ft2 grand-hall with a 100,000 lb glass ceiling.{{cite web|url=http://www.unusualvillarentals.com/caribbean/bahamas/nygard/|title=Nygård Cay|publisher=unusualvillarentals.com|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100626100416/http://www.unusualvillarentals.com/caribbean/bahamas/nygard/|archive-date=2010-06-26|dead-url=yes|accessdate=28 June 2010|df=}} On April 14, 2010 Peter Nygard announced he was planning a $50 million renovation of Nygård Cay, which would take two years to complete and repair the damage and employ 200 construction workers.{{cite web|url=http://www.thenassauguardian.com/bixex/325682364938194.php|title=Nygard pledges 50 million comeback|publisher=[[List of newspapers in the Bahamas|The Nassau Guardian]]|accessdate=June 28, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100627081222/http://www.thenassauguardian.com/bixex/325682364938194.php|archive-date=2010-06-27|dead-url=yes|df=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tribune242.com/searchresults/16082010_nkn-nygard-no-license_news_pg1|title=Nygard Cay is not licensed as commercial property|publisher=The Nassau Tribune|date=August 16, 2010|accessdate=August 31, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100822030630/http://www.tribune242.com/searchresults/16082010_nkn-nygard-no-license_news_pg1|archive-date=2010-08-22|dead-url=yes|df=}} But a letter from the Bahamian prime minister's office rejected his construction application, citing the improper expansion of his property through intentional accretion of land over the seabed. On September 28, 2018 Nygård Cay was seized by the Supreme Court of the Bahamas as part of a legal battle surrounding Nygard’s efforts to dredge the sea floor around the estate [https://theworldnews.net/ca-news/peter-nygard-locked-out-of-his-luxury-home-in-bizarre-bahamas-feud] ==Charity== Nygård has supported the [[Canadian Breast Cancer Foundation]].{{cite web|url=http://www.cnwtelbec.com/en/releases/archive/September2007/30/c6818.html?view=print |title=$26.5 million Raised Nationwide as Canadian Breast Cancer Foundation CIBC Run for the Cure Celebrates Sweet Sixteen |publisher=Cnwtelbec.com |date= |accessdate=2010-04-14}} Nygård has been a longtime sponsor of amateur sports in the Bahamas. In June 2010, is the main sponsor of [[Amateur Boxing Federation of the Bahamas]]' team for Continental Elite Boxing Championships Invitation only event slated for June 13–19 in [[Quito]], Ecuador.{{cite web|url=http://www.tribune242.com/sports/06012010_Nygardsponsorship_sports|title=Nygard sponsoring team for 'invitation only' amateur boxing event|publisher=The Tribune|date=June 1, 2010|accessdate=June 29, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110717100937/http://www.tribune242.com/sports/06012010_Nygardsponsorship_sports|archive-date=2011-07-17|dead-url=yes|df=}} Wellington Miller, the president of the [[Bahamas Olympic Committee]], said Nygård has contributed significantly to the Amateur Boxing Association of the Bahamas and their Olympic success.{{cite web|url=http://www.tribune242.com/sports/03292011_Gibsonhonored_sports|title=Nygard to sponsor Exuma regatta|publisher=The Tribune|date=March 29, 2011|accessdate=April 13, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120315023708/http://www.tribune242.com/sports/03292011_Gibsonhonored_sports|archive-date=2012-03-15|dead-url=yes|df=}} In April 2011, Nygård held the "2011 National Family Island Regatta" at Nygård Cay, which included a press conference to honor Bahamian musician "King" [[Eric Gibson]].{{cite web|url=http://www.jonesbahamas.com/news/123/ARTICLE/22793/2011-03-28.html|title=Nygard Does It Again, Sponsors National F.I. Regatta|publisher=Jones Bahamas|date=March 28, 2011|accessdate=April 13, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tribune242.com/03292011_Gibsonpleased_sports|title=I did everything that I could to make it such a great sport|publisher=The Tribune|date=March 29, 2011|accessdate=April 13, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110429134904/http://www.tribune242.com/03292011_Gibsonpleased_sports|archive-date=2011-04-29|dead-url=yes|df=}} In the same month, Nygård also donated $10,000 to Josie Poitier, a member of [[Old Holy Redeemer Catholic Church]], during a Passover/Good Friday Breakfast/Brunch.{{cite web|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2011/04/25/2184586/after-years-of-giving-volunteer.html|title=After years of giving, volunteer gets recognition, reward|publisher=Miami Herald|date=April 25, 2011|accessdate=April 25, 2011}}{{failed verification|date=August 2014}} ==Lawsuits== Nygård has been accused of [[Abuse|abusive]] labor practices, [[tax evasion]], [[sexual harassment]] and [[rape]].{{cite web|title=Peter Nygard Answers to No One|last=Falkenberg|first=Kai|url=https://www.forbes.com/forbes/2010/1206/features-peter-nygard-sexual-harassment-answers-to-no-one.html#52f40c70bc9b|date=November 18, 2010|publisher=Forbes Media LLC|access-date=October 16, 2018}} *In 1978, Nygård's takeover of a sportswear designer's business in New York City led to a 12-year legal battle in New York federal court. *In 1980, the ''Free Press'' wrote that Nygård was charged with the rape of an 18-year-old girl by Winnipeg authorities. Later those charges were dropped. *Nygård [[Settlement (litigation)|settled]] sexual harassment complaints by three former employees in Manitoba in the late 1990s. *In 1999, Nygård sued [[Linda Brava|Linda Lampenius]] for defamation when she claimed that he hired lookalikes for his [[Oscar party]] and "defrauded the entertainment industry and international press". The case was settled with Lampenius printing an apology in the Finnish press. *In 2003, Nygård was sued in Florida by an American couple who claimed he deceived them into accepting jobs as managers of his Bahamas estate. The case was settled in 2007. *In 2006, Canadian tax authorities claimed Nygård underreported $15 million in taxes. Nygård argued that he severed residential ties with Canada in 1975; he was ultimately subject to taxes on an unreported $2 million.
In 2007 with a bit of irritation over runoff has escalated to a battle royal encompassing no fewer than 16 [[Legal action|legal actions]] between Nygård and [[Louis Bacon|Luis Bacon]] and their associates, in which both sides are claiming damages in the tens of millions of dollars and lobbing allegations of activities that include [[vandalism]], [[bribery]], [[insider trading]], [[arson]], [[murder]], destruction of the fragile seabed, and having a close association with the [[Ku Klux Klan]]. Bacon v. Nygard, 150400/2015, New York State Supreme Court, New York County{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-04-24/billionaire-bacon-s-defamation-suit-against-nygard-reinstated}}
*In 2008, Nygård was sued in Los Angeles Superior Court by a former girlfriend for slamming a door on her hand. Nygård quickly settled the lawsuit.
In 2012, Nygård launched a lawsuit against the [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|CBC]] regarding copyright issues about private videos taken at his residence, which were then used in an April 2010 documentary.{{cite web|url=http://www.lfpress.com/news/canada/2012/02/23/19417251.html|title=Nygard files another lawsuit against CBC|publisher=lfpress.com|date=2012-02-23|access-date=2012-02-24}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tribune242.com/sports/04142010_alnygard_news_pg1|title=Former Deputy PM denies defending Nygard International against immigration accusations|publisher=The Nassau Tribune|date=April 14, 2010|access-date=April 20, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110717100200/http://www.tribune242.com/sports/04142010_alnygard_news_pg1|archive-date=2011-07-17|dead-url=yes|df=}} He had also launched a copyright complaint with the US District Court in New York{{cite web |url=http://www.fftimes.com/node/230384 |title=Fashion mogul Peter Nygård tries to block airing of CBC show |publisher=Fftimes.com |date=2010-01-12 |access-date=2010-04-14 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100426002443/http://www.fftimes.com/node/230384 |archive-date=2010-04-26 |dead-url=yes |df= }}{{cite web|author=Famous Fashionista says: |url=http://www.fashionmagazine.com/blogs/fashion/fashion-news/2010/01/11/nygard-seeks-damages-from-the-cbc/ |title=Nygård seeks damages from the CBC |publisher=fashionmagazine.com |date=2010-01-11 |access-date=2010-04-14}}{{cite web|last=Austen |first=Ian |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/01/11/business/media/11nygard.html?partner=rss&emc=rss |title=Nygard Sues Over Unwanted Media Coverage |location=Canada |publisher=NYTimes.com |date=2010-01-10 |access-date=2010-04-14}} and a lawsuit in Manitoba to prevent the piece from airing.{{cite web|last=Owen |first=Bruce |url=http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/local/cbc-probe-distracts-staff-nygard-claims-81304202.html |title=CBC probe distracts staff, Nygård claims |publisher=Winnipeg Free Press |date=2010-01-13 |access-date=2010-04-14}} He had previously sued two former employees for releasing confidential information and his lawyer claimed CBC harassed many of the employees. Nygård launched a civil suit against his neighbor and the Lyford Cay Property Owners Association alleging they conspired with the CBC to damage his reputation; he also filed a private criminal prosecution against three CBC journalists accusing them of conspiring to discredit him and his clothing empire.{{cite web|url=http://www.torontosun.com/news/canada/2011/04/09/17935196.html|title=Nygard enemy bolts|publisher=Toronto Sun|date=4/9/2011|access-date=2011-04-26}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/fashion-tycoon-peter-nygard-files-criminal-complaint-against-cbc/article1966340/|title=Fashion tycoon Peter Nygard files criminal complaint against CBC|publisher=Toronto Sun|date=4/1/2011|access-date=2011-04-26}}
==Personal life== Nygård currently lives in [[Nassau, Bahamas]]. He has seven children by four women.http://www.fact.on.ca/news/news0210/np021015.htmhttp://www4.nygard.com/scf/News2003.aspx?id=356 He has been married one time, briefly, in the 1970s, to a model.https://www.forbes.com/forbes/2010/1206/features-peter-nygard-sexual-harassment-answers-to-no-one.html He dated [[Anna Nicole Smith]] for several years. He fathered a daughters Alia and Bianca and son Kai, with Patricia Bickle.http://www.winnipegsun.com/2011/08/02/winnipegs-royal-wedding He fathered a son, Mika, with Kaarina Pakka of [[Oakville, Ontario]]. ===Aircraft=== Nygård owns the following [[Boeing 727|Boeing 727-17]] (VP-BPZ) aircraft for personal and corporate use:http://www.planespotters.net/Aviation_Photos/photo.show?id=306953 "Peter Nygård's Aircraft"

{{About|the generic term|the film|Quality Time (film)}} {{refimprove|date=February 2011}} '''Quality time''' ('''QT''') is an informal reference to [[time]] spent with close [[family]], [[significant other|partners]] or [[friend]]s that is in some way important, special, productive or profitable. It is time that is set aside for paying full and undivided attention to the person or matter at hand. It may also refer to time spent performing some favorite activity.
"Quality time" (''[[noun phrase]]'') is a relatively new expression, in use since the 1970s. One of the earliest records of this phrase in print was in the [[Annapolis, Maryland|Annapolis]], [[Maryland]] (United States) newspaper ''[[The Capital]]'', January 1973, in the article "How To Be Liberated": {{quote|The major goal of each of these role changes is to give a woman time to herself, Ms. Burton explained. "A woman's right and responsibility is to be self fulfilling," she said. She gives "quality time" rather than "quantity time" to each task, whether it be writing, cleaning the house or tending the children.}}
Relationship counselor [[Gary_Chapman_(author)|Gary Chapman]] suggests that quality time is one of [[The 5 Love Languages|five "languages"]] which are used (more or less, preferentially, by a given individual) to express love.
==See also== * [[Gemütlichkeit]] * [[Kids club|Kids Clubs]]

page.title: Reactions to the death of Bhumibol Adulyadej

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=November 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2016}} King [[Bhumibol Adulyadej]] of [[Thailand]] [[Death and funeral of Bhumibol Adulyadej|died on 13 October 2016]] after a long illness. Following his death, many sovereign countries and organisations sent a message of condolences.
== Local == Prime Minister [[Prayut Chan-o-cha]] made a speech following the king death in a national mourning announcement: {{quote|His Majesty the King brought people from their hopelessness to their determination, security and courage to cope with obstacles. The reign was a period of comprehensive national development. His Majesty was the beloved King who was the spiritual centre of all Thai people. It was really a 70-year period of righteous reign for the benefit and happiness of Thai people. 13 October will be in the memory of Thai people for good. It was a 70-year period of limitless public benefit and now it is limitless sorrow for the people. The government will inform the National Legislative Assembly that His Majesty the King had appointed the heir in accordance with the royal law on 28 December 1972, and then the National Legislative Assembly will take the relevant action. Please take the opportunity to boost one another's morale. All of us share the same feelings because we have our common father of the nation. Please help protect national peace and do not let anyone trigger conflicts that would lead to turmoil. Thai people. His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej, King Rama IX, has passed away. Long live the new king.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkokpost.com/news/general/1109716/pm-nation-is-in-its-greatest-sorrow-expects-new-king-by-tradition|title=NPM: Nation is in its greatest sorrow, expects new King by tradition|publisher=Bangkok Post|accessdate=13 October 2016|date=29 October 2016}}</ref>}}
== International == === Africa === * {{flag|Liberia}}: President [[Ellen Johnson Sirleaf]] had sent two separate messages of consolation to the Governments and Peoples of the Kingdom of Thailand and the Republic of Haiti. President Sirleaf stated: "It is with profound shock and deep sorrow that we have learned of the death news of His Royal Highness Bhumibol Adulyadej, King of the Kingdom of Thailand".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201610180808.html|title=Liberia Consoles Thailand, Haiti|publisher=All Africa|date=17 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Morocco}}: King [[Mohammed VI of Morocco|Mohammed VI]] sent a message of condolences to Crown Prince Maha Vajiralongkorn. In his message, the King extended his sincere condolences and deep feelings of sympathy and compassion to the Crown Prince, the Thai Royal Family and the friendly Thai people in these painful circumstances. Adding that he recalled the qualities of the late King of Thailand, who devoted his life to serve his country and his people with dedication, loyalty and selflessness, working with wisdom and foresight in the development of the Kingdom of Thailand and its stability.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mapnews.ma/en/activites-royales/hm-king-offers-condolences-crown-prince-thailand-following-death-king-bhumibol-adu|title=HM the King Offers Condolences to Crown Prince of Thailand following Death of King Bhumibol Adulyadej|publisher=Agence Marocaine de Presse|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Nigeria}}: President [[Muhammadu Buhari]] condoled with the royal family, government and people of Thailand on the death of their king, Bhumibol Adulyadej. President Buhari, in a statement, extolled the monarch's extraordinary and committed leadership to his people over a period of seven decades. The president noted the deceased's exceptional stewardship which saw Thailand emerged as one of Southeast Asia's leading economies. He said the "highly revered monarch will be long remembered for his towering role and dedication to improving the lives and aspirations of the Thai people".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201610141018.html|title=Nigeria: Buhari Condoles With Thailand Over Death of Monarch|publisher=All Africa|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Seychelles}}: President [[James Michel]] expressed his condolences to Prime Minister Prayut and said “The king was highly regarded as a unifying father figure with a towering presence. As well an influential and revered figure that commanded the respect of the Thai people as well as the world. The King was prominently engaged in championing democracy over the country he governed with justice, pride and devotion to his people and remained unhinged, being loyal and benevolent in his humble ways to the very end”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.seychellesnewsagency.com//articles/6087/Seychelles+president+sends+condolences+on+passing+of+Thai+King|title=Seychelles’ president sends condolences on passing of Thai King|author=Sharon Uranie|publisher=Seychelles News Agency|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|South Africa}}: President [[Jacob Zuma]] has extended condolences to the people of Thailand following the passing of King Bhumibol Adulyadej. In a statement, the President said "The South African government extends its most sincere condolences to the government and people of the Kingdom of Thailand in this moment of sadness and grief". He also added that during King Adulyadej's tenure, he became a unifying father figure and rare source of stability. In all the 70 years as King of Thailand, His Majesty King Bhumibol worked to serve his people, and was regarded as close to divine by the Thais".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201610140242.html|title=South Africa: SA Mourns Thai King's Passing|publisher=All Africa|date=17 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref>
=== Americas === * {{flag|Argentina}}: The [[Government of Argentina]] deeply regrets over the King death and extends its condolences to the Thai royal family, government and its people. The Argentinian government said “Throughout its 70-year reign, His Majesty has earned the respect and affection not only of the Thai people but also of the entire international community”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://enaun.mrecic.gov.ar/en/node/29036|title=Condolencias de la Argentina por el fallecimiento del Rey de Tailandia|language=Spanish|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Worship|Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Worship (Argentina)]]|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Brazil}}: President [[Michel Temer]] present the condolences of the Brazilian people to the people of Thailand for the passing of their King during his speech in [[Goa]], India for the [[8th BRICS summit]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www2.planalto.gov.br/acompanhe-planalto/discursos/discursos-do-presidente-da-republica/discurso-do-presidente-da-republica-michel-temer-na-cupula-ampliada-dos-chefes-de-estado-e-de-governo-do-brics-e-do-bimstec-goa-india|title=Discurso do presidente da República, Michel Temer, na Cúpula ampliada dos Chefes de Estado e de Governo do BRICS e do BIMSTEC - Goa/Índia|language=Portuguese|publisher=President of Brazil|date=16 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Canada}}: Prime Minister [[Justin Trudeau]] tweeted in his Twitter "My condolences to all those mourning the passing of King Bhumibol Adulyadej. My thoughts are with his loved ones and the people of Thailand".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/justintrudeau/status/786949041338941440|title=[Condolence message]|author=Justin Trudeau|publisher=Twitter|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Guatemala}}: President [[Jimmy Morales]] by means of a press release from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said: "His Majesty the King of Thailand, was recognized and appreciated by his country, was characterized by dedicating his life to the service of his people. The Government of the Republic of Guatemala sends to the People and Kingdom of Thailand, as well as to the Royal family, their most heartfelt sympathy and solidarity."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.minex.gob.gt/noticias/Noticia.aspx?id=26631|title= The Government of Guatemala regrets the death of the King of Thailand, Bhumibol Adulyadej.|language=Spanish|publisher=minex.gob.gt|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=13 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Mexico}}: President [[Enrique Peña Nieto]] tweeted in his Twitter "Regretfully, I have received the news of the death of His Majesty the King of Thailand, Bhumibol Adulyadej. My condolences to the people and government of Thailand for this heartfelt loss".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/EPN/status/786592609988771840|title=[Condolence message]|author=Enrique Peña Nieto|publisher=Twitter|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Nicaragua}}: Vice President and First Lady [[Rosario Murillo]] expressed its nation condolences. In a message, she said “We would like to express our condolences to the people of Thailand, to the families of Thailand, to the Government of Thailand that is in mourning after the death of their King”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.el19digital.com/articulos/ver/titulo:47698-nicaragua-expresa-condolencias-ante-el-fallecimiento-del-rey-bhumibol-de-tailandia|title=Nicaragua expresa condolencias ante el fallecimiento del Rey Bhumibol de Tailandia|author=Yader Prado Reyes|language=Spanish|publisher=El19Digital|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Panama}}: The [[Government of Panama]], through its Foreign Affairs Ministry expressed its condolences to Thailand and said “Panama stands in solidarity with the Government, the People and the Royal House, for such a sensitive loss and wishes for the continued well-being of the Thais”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://noticias.alianzanews.com/187_america/4099288_panama-presenta-sus-condolencias-por-fallecimiento-del-rey-de-tailandia.html|title=Panamá presenta sus condolencias por fallecimiento del rey de Tailandia|language=Spanish|publisher=AlianzaNews.com|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|United States}}: President [[Barack Obama]] offered his condolences to Thailand on the death of the king. Obama said King Bhumibol Adulyadej was a tireless champion of his country's development and also showed an "unflagging devotion" to improving the standard of living for the Thai people. Obama said the king was a close friend of the United States and a valued partner of many US presidents. He recalled meeting the king during a 2012 visit to Thailand. He said the king leaves behind a legacy of care for the Thai people that future generations will cherish.<ref name="nationwide reaction">{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2016/10/13/world/asia/ap-as-thailand-king-the-latest.html|title=The Latest: China Praises Thai King's Friendship|work=The Associated Press|publisher=The New York Times|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161014014819/http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2016/10/13/world/asia/ap-as-thailand-king-the-latest.html|archivedate=14 October 2016|deadurl=yes}}</ref> ** Secretary of Defense [[Ash Carter]] said the men and women of the Department of Defense joined President Obama in offering their condolences to the Royal Family of the Kingdom of Thailand and the people of Thailand. "As his majesty's legacy is being honored around the world, I want in particular to recognise his majesty's contributions to the longstanding alliance between our two nations".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> ** Secretary of State [[John Kerry]] says the United States "stands with the people of Thailand at this difficult time" after the death of its king. Kerry said in a statement "Our thoughts and prayers are with you. King Bhumibol Adulyadej was born in the US, thus a square named for Bhumibol at his birthplace in Cambridge, Massachusetts will remain an enduring memorial to the special bond he created between our peoples. He will be long remembered and will be deeply missed". Although US-Thai relations ties have been strained since a [[2014 Thai coup d'état|2014 military coup]] in Thailand, the two nations are close allies and have diplomatic relations dating back more than 180 years. Bhumibol visited the US twice in the 1960s and addressed Congress.<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> ** Former President [[Bill Clinton]] and former first lady and Democratic Presidential Candidate [[Hillary Clinton]] have offered their heartfelt condolences over the death of Thailand's king, calling him a kind, good leader. "His Majesty deepened ties between the US and Thailand, our first ally in Southeast Asia. He was a true servant leader, acting with wisdom, strength, humility, and genuine care for the welfare of all people. Adding "I was honoured to visit Thailand as President on the 50th year of his reign when we celebrated our shared love of jazz music, and Hillary was grateful to have had the opportunity, with President Obama, to visit with His Majesty on her last trip to Thailand".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/>

The Buddhist Sangha Sects of Siam, Amarapura and Ramanna was introduced to Sri Lanka from Thailand and Myanmar which both were known as Swarnabhoomi".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dailynews.lk/2016/10/18/local/96227|title=Death of King Bhumibol loss to Buddhist world: Maha Sangha|publisher=Daily News|date=18 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Taiwan}}: President [[Tsai Ing-wen]] visited the Thailand Trade and Economic Office in [[Taipei]] to pay homage to the country's King Bhumibol Adulyadej. At the makeshift memorial, Tsai extended her deepest condolences to Thailand for its loss of a great leader in a book of condolences. She wrote "On behalf of the people of the Republic of China (Taiwan), I hereby extend my most profound condolences to the Royal Family and the people of Thailand for their loss of a great leader, His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://focustaiwan.tw/news/aipl/201610170009.aspx|title=President signs book of condolences mourning death of Thai monarch|author1=Sophia Yeh|author2=Elizabeth Hsu|publisher=Focus Taiwan|date=17 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Uzbekistan}}: Interim President [[Shavkat Mirziyoyev]] expressed condolences to Thailand over the King death. Uzbek Foreign Ministry said that Mirziyoyev sent a letter to Queen Sirikit to expressing condolences.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/uzb_official/status/786977873059913729|title=[Condolence message]|author=Uzbekistan|publisher=Twitter|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Vietnam}}: President [[Trần Đại Quang]] led a high-ranking delegation of Vietnam's State, National Assembly and Government to the Thai Embassy in [[Hanoi]]. Writing in the embassy condolence book, "On behalf of the Vietnamese State and people, I offered my deep condolences to the Queen, Royal Family, leaders and people of Thailand, voicing the belief that they will soon overcome this heavy loss to continue developing the country". Adding that "the monarch’s death leaves a great sorrow to the Queen, Royal Family and people of Thailand, as well as the ASEAN Community as a whole. Vietnam always treasures the King’s sentiment towards its people, as well as his precious contributions to the friendship and strategic partnership between our countries".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.vietnamplus.vn/president-pays-tribute-to-late-thai-king/100707.vnp|title=President pays tribute to late Thai King|work=Vietnam News Agency|publisher=Vietnam+|date=17 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> ** [[Ho Chi Minh City]] Municipal Administration offering condolences over the King death and wishing to solidify HCM City’s relations with Thai localities, as well as the two countries’ connections.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.talkvietnam.org/2016/10/hcm-city-offers-condolences-for-thai-kings-death/|title=HCM City offers condolences for Thai King’s death|publisher=Talk Vietnam|date=18 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref>
=== Europe === * {{flag|Belgium}}: King [[Philippe of Belgium|Philippe]] released a statement: "Deeply saddened by the passing of HM [[Bhumibol Adulyadej]] at the end of a long Reign. Our thoughts go to His family and the Thaï population".<ref name="Royal condolences">{{cite web|url=http://royalcentral.co.uk/other/europes-monarchs-mourn-king-bhumibols-death-69493|title=Europe’s monarchs mourn King Bhumibol`s death|author=Oskar Aanmoen|publisher=Royal Central|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Denmark}}: Queen [[Margrethe II]] sent her condolences to the people of Thailand and Queen Sirikit. She said "I was deeply saddened to learn about the demise of your beloved King, His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej. The ties between our families have always been close and Prince Henrik joins me in conveying to you, the Royal family and the people of Thailand our most profound condolences".<ref name="Royal condolences"/> * {{flag|Finland}}: Foreign Minister [[Timo Soini]] tweeted on Twitter: "I'm deeply saddened to receive the news about the passing of His Majesty the King; sincere condolences to the people of Thailand".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> * {{flag|France}}: President [[Francois Hollande]] hailed the king for his "exceptional human qualities, profound sense of justice, his care for modernity and sustainable development that earned him the affection of the Thai people, as well as the world's esteem".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> * {{flag|Germany}}: Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] has expressed her condolences on the death of Thailand's King Bhumibol, saying "the monarch modernised and strengthened his country during his seven decades on the throne. Adding that "Bhumibol had worked tirelessly for the welfare of the Thai people" and steered the country through "political and economic crises".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> ** Foreign Minister [[Frank-Walter Steinmeier]] said Bhumibol had contributed significantly to the friendship between Thailand and Germany.<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> * {{flag|Hungary}}: Foreign Minister [[Péter Szijjártó]] expresses his condolence to Thai officials prior to the meeting of ASEAN foreign ministers in Bangkok. In his statement, he criticising the European Union move to “boycott Thailand”, saying such boycott was an “illogical move, entirely against common sense” while argued that there was a “race” between countries for co-operation with Thailand, which is one of the most promising economies in the region and insisted that Europe’s move to excluding themselves from the competition based on “misunderstood or quasi-arguments” was a bad decision.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hungarytoday.hu/news/foreign-minister-pays-visit-bangkok-expresses-condolences-death-thailands-king-19430|title=Hungary’s Foreign Minister pays visit to Bangkok, expresses condolences over death of Thailand’s King|publisher=Hungary Today|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Ireland}}: President [[Michael D. Higgins]] said the world “lost both its longest reigning head of state and a statesman deeply committed to peace and peaceful co-existence”. He extended his condolences to the people of Thailand, saying: “I wish to express my deepest sympathies to his wife, Queen Sirikit, and his children, in particular to his daughter Maha Chakri Sirindhorn whose visit to Áras an Uachtaráin I recall with fondness, as well as to his wider family and to the people of Thailand”.<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> * {{flag|Italy}}: President [[Sergio Mattarella]] sent a letter of condolence to the Thai royal family. In his message, "I wish to express, on behalf of all the Italian People and my own, deep and sincere condolences on the passing away of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej. He has been a figure of international stature, who has profoundly marked the history of Thailand. His commitment to the development and prosperity of the Kingdom is reflected by the sincere feelings of esteem and affection expressed by His People. Within the deep bond of friendship that unites the Thai and Italian People, our Country today joins the Kingdom of Thailand in mourning His loss".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ambbangkok.esteri.it/ambasciata_bangkok/en/ambasciata/news/dall_ambasciata/2016/10/condolences-message-of-italian.html|title=Condolence message of Italian head of state to the royal family of the Kingdom of Thailand|author=Sergio Mattarella|publisher=Embassy of Italy, Bangkok|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Kosovo}}: President [[Hashim Thaçi]] expressed deepest condolences to people of Thailand for late King Bhumibol Adulyadej. He said "Thailand is such a great ally. We feel sorry for the loss".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://time.com/4529441/thai-king-bhumibol-adulyadej-death-world-mourns|title=World Leaders and Royalty Mourn the Death of Thai King Bhumibol Adulyadej|author=Tara John|publisher=Time|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Lithuania}}: President [[Dalia Grybauskaitė]] sent a letter to Crown Prince Maha Vajiralongkorn. In the letter, she wrote "I was greatly saddened to learn of the passing of King Bhumibol Adulyadej. Allow me to offer the condolences of the Lithuanian people and my personal deep sympathy to you, members of the Royal Family, and to the citizens of Thailand. A dedicated and committed leader, King Bhumibol Adulyadej will be always remembered as a highly respected and dearly loved monarch – King of all the people of Thailand".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lrp.lt/en/activities/condolences/message-of-condolences-to-prince-maha-vajiralongkorn-of-thailand-on-the-passing-of-king-bhumibol-adulyadej/26400|title=Message of condolences to Prince Maha Vajiralongkorn of Thailand on the passing of King Bhumibol Adulyadej|publisher=President of the Republic of Lithuania|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Netherlands}}: King [[Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands|Willem-Alexander]] released a statement: "With emotion I received the news of the death of King Bhumibol Adulyadej of Thailand. For the Thai people he was a beacon of stability, even in turbulent times during his long reign of over seventy years. Again and again he stressed the values of harmony and peaceful cooperation. With warm feelings my wife, my mother and I remember our meeting with him. Our thoughts go out to Queen Sirikit and other members of the Royal Family".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.koninklijkhuis.nl/actueel/nieuws/2016/10/13/reactie-z-m-de-koning-na-overlijden-koning-van-thailand|title=Reactie Z.M. de Koning na overlijden Koning van Thailand|language=Dutch|publisher=Dutch Royal House|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Norway}}: King [[Harald V of Norway|Harald]] sent his condolences to the people of Thailand and Her Majesty Queen Sirikit. He said “I was saddended to hear about the passing away of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej, Rama IX, of Thailand. On behalf of myself and of the people of Norway, I extend my condolences to Your Majesty and to your family, and ask that my deepest sympathy is conveyed to the people of Thailand”.<ref name="Royal condolences"/> * {{flag|Poland}}: President [[Andrzej Duda]] sent a letter of condolence to Thai royal family, government as well to the Thai people. In his message, “His Majesty is recognised in Poland as a symbol of Thailand. Many years of his reign, his courage, wisdom and charismatic leadership has been widely admired. For more than 60 years, His Majesty protected His country and His subjects against the tragic events that had occurred in the history of the region. During His reign, Thai people were proud of their country and Thailand prospered immensely, while at the same preserving the values that are fundamental in constituting the Nation such as culture, tradition, the respect for religion and for family bonds. Today, the Kingdom of Thailand is plunged in deep sorrow and mourns His Majesty. The Republic of Poland, on behalf of which, I am writing these words, would like to express our most sincere compassion to the Royal Family, the Government of the Kingdom of Thailand and to all the people of Thailand. We are joining with you in this difficult time”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bangkok.msz.gov.pl/en/c/MOBILE/news/condolences_|title=Condolences from the President of the Republic of Poland, Mr. Andrzej Duda to His Royal Highness Crown Prince Maha Vajilalongkorn|author=Andrzej Duda|publisher=Embassy of the Republic of Poland in Bangkok|date=18 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Portugal}}: President [[Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa]] sent a message of condolences to the Queen and Crown Prince. In his message, "It was with great consternation that I learned of the death of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej. In this hour of mourning, I present to the royal family and to the whole Thai People, on behalf of the Portuguese People and on my own, the most sincere condolences and deep vows of deep regret. His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej will be remembered for the important legacy he left, for over seventy years, ahead of the Kingdom of Thailand".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.presidencia.pt/?idc=18&idi=116144|title=Presidente da República enviou uma mensagem de condolências à Rainha e ao Príncipe herdeiro do Reino da Tailândia|author=Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa|language=Portuguese|publisher=President of Portugal|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Russia}}: President [[Vladimir Putin]] has sent his condolences over the death of Thailand's king, noting the country's achievements during his 70-year reign. Putin said that King Bhumibol Adulyadej has presided over successful economic development and contributed to the strengthening of Thailand's positions abroad. He said in his telegram that the king won "sincere love of his people and high respect abroad".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> According to [[Kremlin]], Putin also noted in his letter that the king will be remembered in Russia for his support of friendship and co-operation between the two countries. Putin offered his support for the royal family, the government and the people of Thailand.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.kremlin.ru/events/president/news/53086|title=Condolences following the passing of King Bhumibol Adulyadej of Thailand|publisher=President of Russia|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Spain}}: King [[Felipe VI of Spain|Felipe VI]] and Queen [[Queen Letizia of Spain|Letizia]] sent a telegram to Queen Sirikit, extending to Crown Prince Vajiralongkorn, in which they express their condolences and underline the relation between both countries and between both peoples.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.eldiario.es/politica/Felipe-VI-Reina-Letizia-Bhumibol_0_569044049.html|title=Felipe VI y la Reina Letizia expresan su pesar por la muerte del rey Bhumibol|language=Spanish|publisher=eldiario.es|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Sweden}}: Prime Minister [[Stefan Löfven]] told Sweden's [[Tidningarnas Telegrambyrå|TT news agency]], "My condolences to the royal family but also to the whole Thai people. King Bhumibol has meant a lot to the Thai people. That one can notice when in Thailand".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> * {{flag|Ukraine}}: Foreign Minister [[Pavlo Klimkin]] sent his condolences to Thailand. In his message, "With deep sorrow I learnt the news about demise of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej. The King of Thailand was a pillar of stability in rapidly changing times and challenges for the Kingdom. During his reign Thailand embraced industrialisation, social progress and people’s prosperity. He was a true inspiring figure, earning devotion of many of his subjects. May his departure soul rest in peace".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mfa.gov.ua/en/news-feeds/foreign-offices-news/51673-condolences-to-the-royal-family-and-the-people-of-the-kingdom-of-thailand-of-he-pavlo-klimkin-minister-of-foreign-affairs-of-ukraine-on-demise-of-his-majesty-king-bhumibol-adulyadej|title=Condolences to the Royal family, and the people of the Kingdom of Thailand of H.E. Mr. Pavlo Klimkin, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine on demise of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej|author=Pavlo Klimkin|publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Ukraine)]]|date=15 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|United Kingdom}}: Prime Minister [[Theresa May]] issued a statement, expressing her "sincere personal condolences to the royal family and the people of Thailand on the death of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej". She went on, "His Majesty guided the Kingdom of Thailand with dignity, dedication and vision throughout his life. He will be greatly missed".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> ** Foreign Secretary [[Boris Johnson]] also offering his condolences to the people of Thailand. In his message, “I am greatly saddened to hear of the death of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej. He was greatly respected at home and around the globe for his wisdom and dedication. I offer the people of Thailand and the Royal family my profound sympathy at this sad time”.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gov.uk/government/news/foreign-secretarys-message-of-condolence-on-the-death-of-his-majesty-king-bhumibol-adulyadej|title=Foreign Secretary's message of condolence on the death of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej|author=Boris Johnson|publisher=Government of the United Kingdom|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|Vatican City}}: [[Pope Francis]] sent a Telegram to the royal family, saying "I was deeply saddened to learn of the death of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej, and I extend my heartfelt condolences to the Members of the Royal Family and to all the people of the Kingdom at this sorrowful time. I pray that, as a fitting tribute to the late King’s legacy of wisdom, strength and fidelity, all Thais may work together to further the path of peace, and I willingly invoke upon all who mourn his passing the consolation of divine blessings".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.radiovaticana.va/news/2016/10/14/pope_sends_condolences_on_death_of_thai_king_bhumipol/1265200|title=Pope sends condolences on death of Thai King Bhumipol|author=Franciscus PP.|publisher=Vatican Radio|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref>
=== Oceania === * {{flag|Australia}}: Prime Minister [[Malcolm Turnbull]] on Friday described King Bhumibol as "a major figure in modern Asian history". He said through Australian radio [[3AW]], "We are deeply saddened by the passing of His Majesty and we offer our condolences to the Thai royal family and the people of Thailand. He is a major figure in modern Asian history. Under his reign, Thailand's population grew from just under 20 million to over 67 million and of course the strides in economic and social development have been enormous". Adding that "the Thai community in Australia, which is close to 50,000, will particularly feel the loss of His Majesty, a very, very revered figure".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> * {{flag|Fiji}}: Prime Minister [[Voreqe Bainimarama]] condoled the King death and said in a statement, “The passing of your beloved monarch after 70 years as king is a momentous event for Thailand, the Asia Pacific region and the world. His majesty was not only revered by the Thai people for his record period of service to them but represented stability and continuity in our region during some of the most challenging periods of the past few decades”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2016-10/14/c_135754370.htm|title=Fijian PM condoles death of Thailand's king|author=Huaxia|publisher=Xinhua News Agency|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|New Zealand}}: Prime Minister [[John Key]] says his thoughts are with the people of Thailand following the death of the king. He said "King Bhumibol was the world's longest serving monarch and presided over a period of transformative growth and development that saw Thailand emerge as a regional leader and one of Southeast Asia's major economies. Adding that the king and Queen Sirikit visited New Zealand, and that more than 100,000 New Zealanders visit Thailand each year. I extend the New Zealand Government's sincerest condolences to Queen Sirikit, Thailand's Royal Family and all the people of Thailand".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> * {{flag|Papua New Guinea}}: Prime Minister [[Peter O'Neill]] offered his condolences to Prime Minister Prayut and highlighting the strengths of the late monarch. In a statement, he said “I wish to convey our heartfelt and deepest sympathies on behalf of the Government and the people of Papua New Guinea. Over recent years, Papua New Guinea and Thailand have strengthened bilateral relations. His Majesty was a revered leader during his lifetime and proudly represented Thai culture, tradition and heritage around the world for so many decades. As the world's longest serving Monarch, King Bhumibol, led his people as a leader of peace and harmony. Thailand is a very important friend of Papua New Guinea, and we feel for their loss on this sad occasion”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.pngfacts.com/2016/10/papua-new-guinea-extends-sincere.html|title=Papua New Guinea Extends Sincere Condolences on the Passing of King Bhumibol Adulyadej|publisher=Papua New Guinea Today|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref>
== Organisations == === Non-governmental organisations === * {{flag|Association of Southeast Asian Nations}}: In a joint statement, ASEAN sent a message of condolence to Thailand. The message stated, “In this time of national grief and mourning, we wish to extend our heartfelt condolences and sympathy to Members of the Royal Family, the Government and people of the Kingdom of Thailand. As the world’s longest-reigning monarch and revered King of the people of the Kingdom of Thailand, His Majesty’s leadership and great service to the people of the Kingdom of Thailand and contributions to regional and international peace and development will be forever remembered with great respect and admiration”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://asean.org/storage/2016/10/Message-of-Condolences-of-ASEAN-Leaders-on-the-Passing-of-His-Majesty-King-of-the-Kingdom-of-Thailand.pdf|title=Message of Condolences of ASEAN Leaders on The Passing of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej of the Kingdom of Thailand|publisher=Association of Southeast Asian Nations|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016|format=PDF}}</ref> * {{flag|European Union}}: President [[Donald Tusk]] and Commission President [[Jean-Claude Juncker]] sent condolences to Queen Sirikit and members of the Royal Family. In a statement, "It is with great sadness that we have learned of the passing of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej. King Bhumibol was a well-loved and revered King and a key figure in Thailand's recent history. During his more than 70 years on the throne, King Bhumibol's rural development projects improved the lives of millions of people in Thailand. His contributions touched the lives of many and will be remembered for many generations to come. King Bhumibol will be particularly remembered in Europe for his outstanding commitment to the promotion of sustainable development".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.consilium.europa.eu/en/press/press-releases/2016/10/13-tusk-letter-condolences-king-thailand/|title=Statement by Presidents Tusk and Juncker on the passing away of King Bhumibol Adulyadej of Thailand|publisher=European Council Council of the European Union|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * {{flag|United Nations}}: Secretary-General [[Ban Ki-moon]] called him "a unifying national leader" who is "highly respected internationally".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> The UN General Assembly and Security Council stood in silent tribute to Thailand's King Bhumibol, and Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon called him "a unifying national leader" who is "highly respected internationally". Assembly President [[Peter Thompson (diplomat)|Peter Thompson]] asked the assembly at the start of Thursday's meeting to stand for a moment of silence in tribute to the king, who died earlier in the day. Shortly after, Russia's deputy UN ambassador, [[Petr Iliichev]], did the same at the start of a Security Council meeting. The assembly, the council, and the secretary-general sent condolences to the royal family and the government and people of Thailand. Ban said "At this time of sorrow and loss, I hope that Thailand will continue to honour King Bhumibol's legacy of commitment to universal values and respect for human rights".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/>
=== Supranational organisations === * '''[[Asian Development Bank]]''': President [[Takehiko Nakao]] expressed his deepest condolences to the Thai people and Government upon the passing of their King. In a statement, he said “His Majesty demonstrated strong dedication to his people and worked tirelessly for the development and prosperity of Thailand over several decades. King Bhumibol's contributions to the Kingdom will be remembered by generations to come”.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.adb.org/news/adb-president-expresses-condolences-passing-his-majesty-king-bhumibol-adulyadej|title=ADB President Expresses Condolences on The Passing of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej|publisher=Asian Development Bank|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * '''[[Badminton World Federation]]''': BWF president [[Poul-Erik Hoyer]] hailed the late monarch "an inspirational leader who has left his country and the badminton world a great example". "We have always cherished the special relationship which the BWF has enjoyed with His Majesty and indeed with the entire Royal Family of Thailand and, of course, the immense support which badminton has received. "The King's legacy will inspire generations to come and we will always remember his generosity and love for badminton".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bwfbadminton.com/2016/10/14/bwf-mourns-king-bhumibols-passing/|title=BWF mourns King Bhumibol's Passing|author=Gayle Alleyne|publisher=Badminton World Federation|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * '''[[International Boxing Association (amateur)|International Boxing Association]]''': AIBA President [[Wu Ching-kuo]] send condolence to [[National Olympic Committee of Thailand|National Olympic Committee of Thailand under the Royal Patronage of His Majesty the King]]. He said "AIBA deeply regret of His Majesty the King passed away".{{citation needed|date=November 2016}} * '''[[International Olympic Committee]]''': IOC President [[Thomas Bach]] send condolence to [[National Olympic Committee of Thailand|National Olympic Committee of Thailand under the Royal Patronage of His Majesty the King]]. He said "Passed away of His Majesty the King was a great loss of IOC". * '''OANDA''': Currency trading firm OANDA says "it expects investors' nervousness to intensify over fears of political uncertainty following the death of Thailand's king, but it says economic losses will be limited. King Bhumibol Adulyadej, who died Thursday, was a stabilising figure in the Southeast Asian nation, which went through tumultuous change during his 70-year reign". Adding that "although the Thai baht and the stock exchange index will remain under pressure, much of the uncertainty premium is already built into the price of both, thus losses will be limited. We expect the Bank of Thailand will be ready to step in to smooth any disorderly currency moves". It also forecast the military government would extend its tenure to ensure political stability, which "will give support to the SETi (Stock Exchange of Thailand index) once the initial knee-jerk moves have worked through the system".<ref name="nationwide reaction"/> * '''[[Olympic Council of Asia]]''': OCA President Sheikh [[Ahmed Al-Fahad Al-Ahmed Al-Sabah]] send condolence to National Olympic Committee of Thailand under the Royal Patronage of His Majesty the King. He said "OCA deeply regretted of His Majesty the King passed away".{{citation needed|date=November 2016}} * '''[[World Boxing Council]]''': The WBC honours the King, saying in a statement "With the death of beloved King Bhumibol, a golden era is over. There is an ongoing need to continue working on promoting boxing and [[Muay Thai]], to honour the legacy, example and memory of His Royal Highness".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wbcboxing.com/wbceng/news/7536-the-wbc-honors-king-bhumibol|title=The WBC honors King Bhumibol|publisher=World Boxing Council|date=21 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref> * '''[[World Wide Fund for Nature]]''': The Thai branch of WWF saddened over the King passing and appreciates his leadership in the conservation of Thailand’s vast natural resources of wildlife, forests, rivers and oceans. The King also has long supported the conservation of Thailand’s elephants and the protection of its [[List of national parks of Thailand|national parks]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wwf.panda.org/wwf_news/?281170/Statement-on-the-Passing-of-HRH-King-Bhumibol-Adulyadej|title=Statement from WWF-Thailand on the Passing of Royal Highness King Bhumibol Adulyadej|publisher=World Wide Fund for Nature|date=14 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref>
===Others=== The [[Current reigning monarchs by length of reign|current longest reigning monarch]] and [[List of current state leaders by date of assumption of office|head of state]], Queen [[Elizabeth II]] sent a private message of condolence to Queen Sirikit and upcoming heir Vajiralongkorn.<ref name="Royal condolences"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://royalcentral.co.uk/other/the-queen-joins-in-the-messages-of-condolence-following-king-bhumibols-death-69456|title=The Queen joins in the messages of condolence following King Bhumibol’s death|author=Charlie Proctor|publisher=Royal Central|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref>
The [[14th Dalai Lama|14th]] [[Dalai Lama]] of [[Tibet]] expressed sadness on learning of the passing away of the King and offered condolences to the members of the royal family and Thai people.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dalailama.com/news/2016/his-holiness-the-dalai-lama-expresses-condolences-at-the-passing-away-of-the-king-of-thailand|title=His Holiness the Dalai Lama Expresses Condolences at the Passing Away of the King of Thailand|publisher=His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama of Tibet|date=13 October 2016|accessdate=22 October 2016}}</ref>
